jtxt.emulator.tui

Class Container<T extends Component>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.tui.Component
      • jtxt.emulator.tui.Container<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of Components this Container should hold. In general, a Container may be instantiated with Component, but instantiation of subclass of Component is necessary if you wish for methods such as getChild(int) to return Components of that type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Component>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RootContainer, Table

    public class Container<T extends Component>
extends Component
implements java.lang.Iterable<Component>
    A Container is a Component which owns and manages other Components. The Components which a Container manages are said to be children of that Container. Various elements of a Container may be specified when it's created, including the Layout which defines how these children will be allocated bounds within their parent.

    • Field Detail

      • children

        protected java.util.List<T extends Component> children
        A collection of all the children this container owns. Components owned by this container inherit certain properties of it. This container may also dictate the way that components added to it appear on the screen.

      • layout

        protected Layout layout
        The layout that determines how the children of this container will be placed within it.

      • draw

        public void draw(GlyphBuffer buffer)
        Description copied from class: Component
        Renders the component within the bounds of that this component has been inflated to. A component which updates Glyphs within the bounds that have been allocated by the Layout can be sure that the characters will be updated appropriately; the behavior for a component which does not is undefined.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Component
        Parameters:
        buffer - An object on which a component can draw itself, and which makes certain guarantees about conforming to the bounds which are allocated by a Container's layout.

      • setBounds

        Description copied from class: Component
        Sets the bounds of this component to the given Region.
        Overrides:
        setBounds in class Component
        Parameters:
        bounds - The new bounds that this component may use to render itself within.
